required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rainbow Acoustic Monitoring (RAM) in Patients Weighing up to 10kg Comparison Study
clinical_study.official_title: Rainbow Acoustic Monitoring (RAM) in Patients Weighing up to 10kg Comparison Study

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this clinical investigational study is to compare the acoustic respiration rates (RRa) obtained using the INVSENSOR0004 sensor in the subjects up to 10 kg with the respiration rates determined by manual annotations (RRref), and when applicable with capnography respiration rate (RRcap).

primary_outcome.time_frame: One study visit lasting up to 60 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: Acoustic respiration rate (RRa) as determined by the INVSENSOR00004 will be compared to measurements of actual respiration rates as determined by manual annotation of recorded respiration waveform (RRref) data. Evaluation of the RRa measurements will be reported as bias between the RRa and the RRref.

arm_group.description: All enrolled subjects will receive the INVSENSOR00004 sensor. The INVSENSOR00004 rainbow acoustic monitoring (RAM) acoustic respiration sensor is designed to noninvasively convert acoustical airflow patterns into respiratory rate (RRa).

intervention.description: The INVSENSOR00004 will be placed on the subject's neck or chest to provide acoustic respiration rate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects weighing up to 10kg
- Subjects will be inpatients and/or outpatients admitted to the NICU (Neonatal Intensive Care Unit) or PICU (Pediatric Intensive Care Unit) or PACU (Post-Anaesthesia Care Unit)
- The parent/legal guardian has given written informed consent/assent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with underdeveloped skin
- Subjects with skin abnormalities at the planned application sites that may interfere with sensor application, per directions-for-use (DFU) or trans-illumination of the site, such as burns, scar tissue, infections, abnormalities, etc.
- Subjects deemed not suitable for the study at the discretion of the investigator.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: INVSENSOR00004
group.description: All enrolled subjects will receive the INVSENSOR00004 sensor. The INVSENSOR00004 rainbow acoustic monitoring (RAM) acoustic respiration sensor is designed to noninvasively convert acoustical airflow patterns into respiratory rate (RRa). INVSENSOR00004: The INVSENSOR00004 will be placed on the subject's neck or chest to provide acoustic respiration rate.

group.title: INVSENSOR00004
group.description: All enrolled subjects will receive the INVSENSOR00004 sensor. The INVSENSOR00004 rainbow acoustic monitoring (RAM) acoustic respiration sensor is designed to noninvasively convert acoustical airflow patterns into respiratory rate (RRa). INVSENSOR00004: The INVSENSOR00004 will be placed on the subject's neck or chest to provide acoustic respiration rate.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Accuracy of Acoustic Respiration Rate (RRa)
outcome.description: Acoustic respiration rate (RRa) as determined by the INVSENSOR00004 will be compared to measurements of actual respiration rates as determined by manual annotation of recorded respiration waveform (RRref) data. Evaluation of the RRa measurements will be reported as bias between the RRa and the RRref.
outcome.time_frame: One study visit lasting up to 60 minutes.
outcome.population: Sufficient number of cases to meet sample size criteria for assessing outcomes was not achieved. The protocol required a minimum of 18 subjects with valid breaths to calculate the bias, precision, and ARMS of the study. This study was not able to meet this target and therefore the bias, precision, and ARMS could not be calculated (primary outcome measure).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
